meanings.definition: A public road in a city or town, typically with buildings on either side.
meanings.sent1: The streets were bustling with cars and pedestrians.
meanings.sent2: I live on a quiet street with friendly neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The streets were so crowded that even the pigeons had to walk.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a maze of streets, each leading to a different memory.
meanings.sent5: The streets whispered stories of the past with every step.

meanings.definition: The people who live or work in a particular street.
meanings.sent1: The streets greeted each other with smiles every morning.
meanings.sent2: Our streets organized a block party to celebrate the holidays.
meanings.sent3: The streets were abuzz with gossip about the new neighbors.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was as intertwined as the streets in a small town.
meanings.sent5: The streets echoed with laughter and chatter late into the night.

meanings.definition: The area of a city or town where most of the shops, restaurants, etc., are located.
meanings.sent1: The streets were lined with colorful shops selling all kinds of treats.
meanings.sent2: I love exploring the streets of downtown for unique finds.
meanings.sent3: The streets seemed to have a magnetic pull towards the ice cream parlor.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, the streets of the city were a treasure map waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The streets hummed with the aroma of freshly baked bread from the bakery.
